resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">

  </identifier>

  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>ILMoE</catalog>
            <entry>ILMoE1220</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">The Kohen Training Center</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Die Kohen Training Mitte</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Le Centre de Formation de Kohen</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">O Centro de aprendizado De Kohen</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Il Centro Di Addestramento Di Kohen</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Το κέντρο κατάρτισης Kohen</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">El Centro De Entrenamiento De Kohen</string>
          </title>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="en">This webquest is designed to introduce learners to the key ideas found in chapter 16 in VaYikra (Leviticus). This chapter describes the avodah (service) that was performed by the Kohen Gadol (High Priest) in the Bais HaMikdash (Temple) on Yom Kippur (Day of Atonement). The aavodah was the most significant component of the holiest day on the Jewish calendar. Through its successful completion, the Kohen Gadol achieved atonement for the entire Jewish nation.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Avodah of Yom Kippur</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">cohen gadol</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Bais HaMikdash</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">avodah</string>
          </keyword>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Dieses webquest ist konzipiert, um Anfänger zu 
den Schlüsselideen vorzustellen, die in Kapitel 16 in VaYikra 
(Leviticus) gefunden werden. Dieses Kapitel beschreibt das 
avodah (Service) das durch das Kohen Gadol (hoher Priester) im Bais 
HaMikdash (Bügel) auf Yom Kippur (Tag von Atonement) durchgeführt 
wurde. Das aavodah war der bedeutendste Bestandteil des 
heiligsten Tages auf dem jüdischen Kalender. Durch seine 
erfolgreiche Beendigung erzielte das Kohen Gadol atonement für die 
gesamte jüdische Nation.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Ce webquest est conçu pour présenter des 
étudiants aux idées principales trouvées en chapitre 16 dans 
VaYikra (Leviticus). Ce chapitre décrit l'avodah (service) qui 
a été exécuté par le Kohen Gadol (haut prêtre) dans le Bais 
HaMikdash (temple) sur Yom Kippur (jour d'Expiation). 
L'aavodah était le composant le plus significatif du jour le 
plus saint sur le calendrier juif. Par son accomplissement 
réussi, le Kohen Gadol a réalisé l'expiation pour la nation juive
entière.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Este o mais webquest é projetado introduzir 
learners às idéias chaves encontradas no capítulo 16 em VaYikra 
(Leviticus). Este capítulo descreve o avodah (serviço) que foi
executado pelo Kohen Gadol (priest elevado) no Bais HaMikdash (temple)
em Yom Kippur (dia de Atonement). O aavodah era o componente o 
mais significativo do dia o mais holiest no calendário jewish. 
Com sua conclusão bem sucedida, o Kohen Gadol conseguiu o 
atonement para a nação jewish inteira.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Questo più webquest è destinato per introdurre 
i principianti alle idee chiave trovate nel capitolo 16 in VaYikra 
(Leviticus). Questo capitolo descrive il avodah (servizio) che 
è stato effettuato dal Kohen Gadol (alto priest) nel Bais HaMikdash 
(tempiale) su Yom Kippur (giorno di Atonement). Il aavodah era 
il componente più significativo del giorno più santo sul calendario 
ebreo. Con il relativo completamento riuscito, il Kohen Gadol ha
realizzato il atonement per l'intera nazione ebrea.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αυτός ο pjo' ωεψquεστ έχει ως σκοπό να εισαγάγει 
τους αρχαρίους στις βασικές ιδέες που βρίσκονται στο κεφάλαιο 
16 σε VaYikra (Leviticus). Αυτό το κεφάλαιο 
περιγράφει το avodah (υπηρεσία) που εκτελέσθηκε από το Kohen
Gadol (υψηλός ιερέας) στο Bais HaMikdash (ναός) σε Yom 
Kippur (ημέρα της επανόρθωσης). Το aavodah ήταν το 
σημαντικότερο συστατικό της πιό ιερής ημέρας στο εβραϊκό 
ημερολόγιο. Μέσω της επιτυχούς ολοκλήρωσής του, το Kohen
Gadol επέτυχε την επανόρθωση για το ολόκληρο εβραϊκό έθνος.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Este la ma's webquest se diseña para introducir 
a principiantes a las ideas dominantes encontradas en el capítulo 16 
en VaYikra (Leviticus). Este capítulo describe el avodah 
(servicio) que fue realizado por el Kohen Gadol (sacerdote alto) en el
Bais HaMikdash (templo) en Yom Kippur (día de Atonement). El 
aavodah era el componente más significativo del día más santo en el
calendario judío. Con su terminación acertada, el Kohen Gadol 
alcanzó el atonement para la nación judía entera.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Avodah von Yom Kippur</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">cohen gadol</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Bais HaMikdash</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">avodah</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Avodah de Yom Kippur</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">cohen le gadol</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Bais HaMikdash</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">avodah</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Avodah de Yom Kippur</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">cohen o gadol</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Bais HaMikdash</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">avodah</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Avodah di Yom Kippur</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">cohen il gadol</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Bais HaMikdash</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">avodah</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Avodah Yom Kippur</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">το gadol</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Bais HaMikdash</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>

          <keyword>
